Based on the search results, I can provide information about "Chłopi" by Władysław Stanisław Reymont as a mandatory reading (lektura obowiązkowa) for Polish high schools (liceum) and technical schools (technikum) according to the curriculum standards (podstawa programowa) from the Ministry of Education (MEN):

## Status as Mandatory Reading

Władysław Stanisław Reymont's "Chłopi" is included as a mandatory reading for high schools and technical schools. Specifically, "Chłopi" is a mandatory reading at the basic level, and in classes only the first volume titled "Jesień" (Autumn) is discussed.

## Current Curriculum Requirements

From the 2021/2022 school year, a new canon of school readings has been in effect in general education high schools and technical schools, with the amendment to the curriculum regulation coming into force on September 1st.

The work appears in different forms across the curriculum:

1. **Basic Level**: Władysław Stanisław Reymont, "Chłopi" (fragments)

2. **Extended Level**: For supplementary readings at the extended level, "Chłopi" (tom II – Zima) / "Chłopi" (volume II - Winter) is included

## About the Work

"Chłopi" is a novel by Władysław Reymont for which he received the Nobel Prize in 1924, published in volumes between 1904 and 1909. In 1924, as the second Pole, he received the Nobel Prize for the novel "Chłopi" which he wrote for over seven years.

The search confirms that "Chłopi" remains an important part of the Polish secondary education curriculum, appearing both as mandatory reading at the basic level (typically volume I - Jesień/Autumn) and as supplementary reading at the extended level (volume II - Zima/Winter).
